info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 29 at 1:35PM PDT until September 2 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Temperatures up to 100 expected.
* WHERE...Eastern San Fernando Valley, Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area, Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles, Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley, Santa Clarita Valley, Southeastern Ventura County Valleys, Western San Fernando Valley, and Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area.
* WHEN...From 10 AM Monday to 6 PM PDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...There is a high risk for heat illness for sensitive populations including the very young, the very old, those without air conditioning, and those active outdoors.
info.instruction:
Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.
To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

parameter.value: HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MONDAY TO 6 PM PDT TUESDAY

area.areaDesc: Santa Clarita Valley; Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Western San Fernando Valley; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley
